title: World War I
key_facts: Global conflict triggered by the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in 1914
Central Powers vs. Allied Powers across multiple fronts
Trench warfare and industrialized weaponry defined combat
causes: Militarism and arms race among European powers
Alliance system that escalated regional tensions into global war
outcome: Germany signed an armistice on November 11, 1918.
Treaty of Versailles formally ended the war in 1919.
impacts: Redrawn borders and collapse of empires (Ottoman, Austro-Hungarian, Russian)
Treaty of Versailles set conditions leading to World War II
Advances in medicine and technology; societal shifts in roles and rights
